text: The Hawaii-Aleutian time zone subtracts ten hours from UTC during standard time (UTC-10) and nine hours during daylight saving time (UTC-9). This time zone is called Hawaii-Aleutian Standard Time (HST) during standard time (Winter). It is called Hawaii-Aleutian Daylight Time (HDT) during daylight saving time (Summer). Places that are in Hawaii-Aleutian Time Zone United States -Hawaii (No DST) -Alaska (Western Aleutian Islands west of 169.5 degrees W) France Most of french polynesia. Category:Time zones
